words.phonetic: tə duː wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs bɛst
words.defineEn: to try to do something as well as one is capable of
words.defineVi: để cố gắng làm một cái gì đó cũng như một người có khả năng

examples: Do away with private insurance.
The Snapdragon 888 does away with that completely.
We're going to do away with premiums and co-payments and deductibles and out-of-pocket expenses.
Unlike other processors, Square did away with complex contracts and additional fees.
A superhabitable planet would do away with these barren landscapes to support more species and more diversity.
words.defineEn: to stop using or having something
words.defineVi: để ngừng sử dụng hoặc có một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to create a memorable or lasting effect on someone or something
words.defineVi: để tạo ra một hiệu ứng đáng nhớ hoặc lâu dài trên một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Schools have welcomed such arrangements with open arms.
The floral arrangements adorned the altar, adding beauty to the church ceremony.
The company's income tax arrangement has been denounced as a sweetheart deal.
When dealing with important financial arrangements, it is imperative that you do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
He decided to voice his concerns and was able to negotiate a better work arrangement.
words.defineEn: an agreement made with someone
words.defineVi: một thỏa thuận được thực hiện với một ai đó

examples: Company profits took a tumble last year.
All members of the band equally share the band's profits.
The company's profits are on the rocks due to poor management decisions.
The bottom line for 2014 was a pre-tax profit of £85 million.
The company made big profits and the workers want a slice of the pie.
words.defineEn: (economics) the sum of money that is gained after all expenses and taxes are paid
words.defineVi: (kinh tế học) tổng số tiền thu được sau khi trả tất cả các chi phí và thuế

examples: The end-of-year accounts show a loss.
Her loss has been keenly felt.
The team's performance is standing on shaky ground after a series of losses.
The company based its projections on shaky ground, leading to financial losses.
The new CEO is making a lot of tough decisions to cut the company’s losses.
words.defineEn: the state or fact of losing someone or something
words.defineVi: tình trạng hoặc thực tế mất một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Her groundbreaking research has revolutionized the scientific community.
Her early research laid the foundation for many important medical discoveries.
The department led the world in cancer research.
Budget cuts are putting the squeeze on scientific research.
Her research has been ruffling feathers for years.
words.defineEn: a careful and systematic study of a subject to discover new facts or information about it
words.defineVi: một nghiên cứu cẩn thận và có hệ thống về một chủ đề để khám phá những sự kiện hoặc thông tin mới về nó

words.phonetic: tə meɪk wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs muːv
words.defineEn: to take action on something that someone has planned to, often when they find the right time
words.defineVi: thực hiện hành động về điều gì đó mà ai đó đã lên kế hoạch, thường là khi họ tìm thấy thời điểm thích hợp

words.defineEn: to help someone without expecting anything in return
words.defineVi: để giúp đỡ ai đó mà không mong đợi bất cứ điều gì trở lại

words.defineEn: to try to do or accomplish something, particularly something difficult
words.defineVi: để cố gắng làm hoặc hoàn thành một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó khó khăn

examples: Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
The business is losing money.
The business has legs.
Many businesses use the Salesforce platform for customer relationship management.
words.defineEn: the activity of providing services or products in exchange for money
words.defineVi: hoạt động cung cấp dịch vụ hoặc sản phẩm để đổi lấy tiền

words.phonetic: tə meɪk ɐ slæʃ ðə dɪfɹəns
words.defineEn: to have a very strong and noticeable effect on someone or something
words.defineVi: để có một hiệu ứng rất mạnh mẽ và đáng chú ý trên một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: The decision is in the hands of the judge.
The decision comes in a case brought by the residents of a small town in Alabama.
This decision is, I feel, a huge mistake.
I can’t make a decision just yet.
The company's profits are on the rocks due to poor management decisions.
words.defineEn: a choice or judgment that is made after adequate consideration or thought
words.defineVi: một sự lựa chọn hoặc phán đoán được thực hiện sau khi xem xét đầy đủ hoặc suy nghĩ

examples: On the face of it, his suggestion makes sense.
Thanks for the pearl of wisdom, buddy, but your suggestion is ridiculous.
Could I make a suggestion?
She made the suggestions entirely off her own bat.
A CEO may receive helpful suggestions from the least experienced employee, as even a mouse may help a lion.
words.defineEn: the act of putting an idea or plan forward for someone to think about or consider
words.defineVi: hành động đưa ra một ý tưởng hoặc kế hoạch để ai đó suy nghĩ hoặc xem xét

examples: By degrees their business relationship grew into friendship.
The temperature outside is nineteen degrees Celsius.
The temperature dropped to minus eighty degrees Celsius in Antarctica.
Rivalries and prejudice were by degrees fading out.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: the certificate that is given to university or college students upon successful completion of their course
words.defineVi: chứng chỉ được trao cho sinh viên đại học hoặc cao đẳng sau khi hoàn thành thành công khóa học của họ

examples: Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
The coast is clear.
Sanskrit inscriptions are clear as day.
The house rules are crystal clear.
The answers came back clear as a bell.
words.defineEn: easy to understand
words.defineVi: dễ hiểu

examples: Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
It's now or never, so make up your mind.
The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
What he lacks in book knowledge he makes up with his street smarts and policing instincts, which often prove equally helpful to the investigation.
Before making up your mind, you need to give both sides a fair hearing.
words.defineEn: to fabricate a story, etc. usually for entertainment or deception
words.defineVi: để bịa ra một câu chuyện, vv thường là để giải trí hoặc lừa dối

words.defineEn: to do something in order to replace something lost or fix something damaged
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó để thay thế một cái gì đó bị mất hoặc sửa chữa một cái gì đó bị hư hỏng

words.defineEn: to steal something and run away with it
words.defineVi: để ăn cắp một cái gì đó và chạy trốn với nó

words.phonetic: ɛsbiː kʊd duː wɪðaʊt ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to go on or manage without someone or something
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục hoặc quản lý mà không có ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.phonetic: ɛsbiː kʊd duː wɪð ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: used to mean that one benefits from having someone or something present or available to one
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để có nghĩa là một người được hưởng lợi từ việc có ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó hiện tại hoặc có sẵn cho một người

examples: and I did up the Inca trail to Machu Picchu in Peru.
It's all done up front in front of the camera.
So what, what do you do up here?
So what I'm going to do up here is I'm going to write a little simple program that will essentially just define a bunch of strings for me.
What's Santa doing up on the rooftop?
words.defineEn: to fasten, button, zip, or otherwise secure something, often related to clothing or accessories
words.defineVi: để buộc chặt, nút, khóa kéo hoặc bảo vệ thứ gì đó, thường liên quan đến quần áo hoặc phụ kiện

examples: This is rubbish!
Each 180-litre container will hold up to three black bags of rubbish.
Each 180-litre container will hold up to three black bags of rubbish.
The thing is, you're rubbish at copying your own code.
When he saw that people used the Holy Mount in the middle of the town as a place for rubbish, he started to clean it with his own hands.
words.defineEn: unwanted, worthless, and unneeded things that people throw away
words.defineVi: những thứ không mong muốn, vô giá trị và không cần thiết mà mọi người vứt đi

examples: The puppies in the litter are like two peas in a pod.
She was silent for a while, lost in thought, staring at the books littering the room.
Well, cats have big litters.
Is this kitty litter?
The nomadic Scythians littered the steppes with grave mounds known as kurgans.
words.defineEn: waste such as bottles, papers, etc. that people throw on a sidewalk, park, or other public place
words.defineVi: chất thải như chai lọ, giấy, v.v. mà mọi người vứt trên vỉa hè, công viên hoặc nơi công cộng khác

examples: Nobody lives in that house since old Roger popped his clogs.
The roads are clogged with evacuees.
A clog near the eye can cause vision problems and retinal detachment.
And makeup doesn't clog?
Otherwise our courts would be clogged with policy debates.
words.defineEn: to make it so that nothing can move through something
words.defineVi: để làm cho nó để không có gì có thể di chuyển qua một cái gì đó

examples: Has Trump drained the swamp in Washington?
Ronald Reagan called for draining the swamp of bureaucrats in Washington D.C. while in 2006.
Our work in Iraq is valuable and important, but we cannot put our faith in draining the swamp of terrorism by military means alone.
The light from big cities would totally swamp its sensors.
Drain the swamp!
words.defineEn: to flood or inundate with water, typically to the point of making an area saturated or soaked or difficult to traverse
words.defineVi: ngập lụt hoặc ngập nước, điển hình là đến mức làm cho một khu vực bị bão hòa hoặc ướt sũng hoặc khó đi qua

examples: I know you're upset, Sarah, but that doesn't give you a free pass to treat other people like garbage.
So, garbage is a resource.
So the shuttle command is garbage.
A stamper then packs in the garbage.
They basically eat our garbage!
words.defineEn: household materials that have no use anymore
words.defineVi: vật liệu gia đình không còn sử dụng nữa

examples: Space debris comes in all sizes.
The big issue was the debris on the ground.
But Amnesty found debris outside.
We see a lot of debris.
This tiny spider has created debris that looks like a big spider.
words.defineEn: the scattered fragments or remains of something that has been broken, destroyed, or discarded, typically resulting from a natural disaster, accident, or wreckage
words.defineVi: các mảnh vỡ rải rác hoặc phần còn lại của một thứ gì đó đã bị hỏng, bị phá hủy hoặc bị loại bỏ, thường là do thiên tai, tai nạn hoặc đống đổ nát

examples: You can add a touch of sweetness to your omelet by swirling some ketchup into the beaten eggs before cooking.
They swirled chocolate syrup into their milkshakes, turning them into creamy and indulgent beverages.
The soup was topped with a swirl of cream and a sprinkle of chopped chives as a garnish.
Enhance the flavor of a warm bowl of rice pudding by swirling in a spoonful of kaymak.
The fire was swirling around the houses.
words.defineEn: to move in a twisting or whirling motion, creating a pattern of circular or spiral motion
words.defineVi: di chuyển theo chuyển động xoắn hoặc xoáy, tạo ra một mô hình chuyển động tròn hoặc xoắn ốc

examples: Gobble the cobble.
so if you ever hear a turkey make that gobble gobble sound you know it's a Tom turkey
so if you ever hear a turkey make that gobble gobble sound you know it's a Tom turkey
words.defineEn: to eat something quickly and greedily, often making loud and rapid swallowing sounds
words.defineVi: ăn một cái gì đó một cách nhanh chóng và ngấu nghiến, thường phát ra âm thanh nuốt lớn và nhanh

examples: If push comes to shove, the government will impose quotas on imports.
Fifty five countries have imposed comprehensive restrictions on the manufacturing, import and distribution of bags.
Imposing a quarantine.
In response, the government imposed a 70 percent tax on liquor.
Stricter safety standards were imposed.
words.defineEn: to force someone to do what they do not want
words.defineVi: để buộc ai đó làm những gì họ không muốn

examples: Turquoise balloons are louder.
It's turquoise.
Turquoise, and I got a Pikachu.
Kathryne asks, Turquoise.
This is a button, it's turquoise, which is my favourite colour.
words.defineEn: a bright bluish-green color
words.defineVi: một màu xanh lục tươi sáng

examples: Michelangelo's sculptures and paintings are a testament to the fact that genius is an infinite capacity for taking pains.
The shapes are practically infinite.
After all, space is infinite.
It has infinite uses!
The Whole Universe is probably infinite.
words.defineEn: without end or limits in number, size, or space
words.defineVi: không có kết thúc hoặc giới hạn về số lượng, kích thước hoặc không gian

examples: The farmer fed the chickens with corn and grains.
Take a stock tip with a grain of salt.
She sprinkled some grains of paradise on her roasted vegetables.
My vegetarian friend enjoyed a nourishing adzuki bean grain bowl for lunch.
Autobiographies should be taken with a grain of salt.
words.defineEn: a small particle or granule
words.defineVi: một hạt nhỏ hoặc hạt

examples: It's a MAJOR middleman in the GROCERY store-to-charity Food Chain.
words.defineEn: the sequence of organisms in an ecosystem where each organism serves as a source of food for the next organism in the chain
words.defineVi: trình tự của các sinh vật trong một hệ sinh thái trong đó mỗi sinh vật đóng vai trò là nguồn thức ăn cho sinh vật tiếp theo trong chuỗi

examples: Amy was passionate about environmental conservation and wouldn't be caught dead using single-use plastic products.
Is banning single-use plastic bottles a good idea?
Should we ban single-use plastic bottles?
Single-use batteries powered everything, but power was never actually a problem.
High-end anti-aging products are some of the most expensive single-use items in the world.
words.defineEn: referring to items or products that are designed to be used once and then discarded
words.defineVi: đề cập đến các mặt hàng hoặc sản phẩm được thiết kế để sử dụng một lần rồi loại bỏ

examples: I mean, you know, infrastructure has become a throwaway line.

But in my experience, these are sort of throwaway.
That is such a throwaway line
words.defineEn: having been discarded or thrown away
words.defineVi: đã bị loại bỏ hoặc vứt bỏ

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: said to express agreement to something, usually reluctantly
words.defineVi: nói để bày tỏ sự đồng ý với một cái gì đó, thường là miễn cưỡng

words.defineEn: used as a filler phrase to pause or fill gaps in speech
words.defineVi: được sử dụng như một cụm từ phụ để tạm dừng hoặc lấp đầy khoảng trống trong bài phát biểu

examples: Over seven hundred Facebook users have already liked the company’s website.
He likes the comfortable seats and big screen at the movie theater.

Like the commandments written in stone.
Such helps were like drop in the ocean.
words.defineEn: used as a filler word or hesitation marker
words.defineVi: được sử dụng như một từ phụ hoặc điểm đánh dấu do dự

words.defineEn: used in speech to provide emphasis, or to signal a pause in speech while the speaker gathers their thoughts
words.defineVi: được sử dụng trong bài phát biểu để nhấn mạnh hoặc để báo hiệu tạm dừng bài phát biểu trong khi người nói thu thập suy nghĩ của họ

words.defineEn: used to draw attention to a point or to emphasize a statement or explanation
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thu hút sự chú ý đến một điểm hoặc để nhấn mạnh một tuyên bố hoặc giải thích

examples: He’s a kind of poor man’s James Bond.
well, I took a beating in prison and I kind of lost my hearing, you know.
Among all kinds of pepper, my favorite is jalapeno for its spicy and flavorful kick.
Not every girl has the stomach for that kind of thing.
For a football player, that kind of injury is par for the course.
words.defineEn: in some ways or to some degree
words.defineVi: theo một số cách hoặc ở một mức độ nào đó

examples: That's sort of like trying to nail Jell-O to the wall.
That sort of attitude really gets my goat.
That sort of thing scares the living daylights out of me.
Before, I was chasing my tail like some sort of lunatic.
This sort of thing only happens like this once in a blue moon.
words.defineEn: to a degree or extent that is unclear
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ không rõ ràng

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.
I went to college anyway, as a part-time student, paying my own way.
but i waved a dead chicken and corrected the spelling anyway.
Sarah knew that skipping classes would hurt her grades, but she did it anyway.
I know it's risky, but if I'm going to get in trouble anyway, I might as well be hanged for a sheep as a lamb.
words.defineEn: used when ending a conversation, or changing, or returning to a subject
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi kết thúc cuộc trò chuyện hoặc thay đổi hoặc quay lại chủ đề

examples: The vibrant orange color of a ripe nectarine is so appealing.
so I ate my fill.
The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
So, did you get the promotion?
So who spilled the beans about her affair with David?
words.defineEn: used to summarize or draw a conclusion based on previous information or to provide a logical inference
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để tóm tắt hoặc đưa ra kết luận dựa trên thông tin trước đó hoặc để cung cấp một suy luận logic
